title: Some Useful Functions
text: package brings together functions created perform repetitive tasks. NB: README file work progress, info functions please see specific help files package installed

title: Some Useful Functions
text: Install latest release following code: ’d like install latest development version can omit @*release call install_github().

previous_headings: Functions > Working with data from CTRU database
title: Some Useful Functions
text: lookups file provided export Edith database specification (opposed export prospect) function wrangles lookups fields data frames format usable read_prospect() apply_labels().

previous_headings: Functions > Working with data from CTRU database
title: Some Useful Functions
text: function reads data prospect database. takes file path exported csv file data dictionary (typically called ‘lookups.csv’); applies factor labels basic formatting. NB: lookups file can provided couple different formats, currently read_prospect() works one . See wrangle_lookups() need convert format.

previous_headings: Functions > Working with data from CTRU database

text: function applies field labels column data frame. particularly useful creating summary table (e.g. discrete_table(), see ).

title: Some Useful Functions
text: function checks read file lengths export notes provided prospect. NB: experimental moment limited checking

title: Some Useful Functions
text: Creates summary table specified continuous variables data frame. grouping variable can provided optional total column (see totals()), well options.

title: Some Useful Functions
text: Creates summary table specified discrete (factor) variables data frame. grouping variable can provided optional total column (see totals()), well options.

title: Some Useful Functions
text: Creates table summarising whether specified variables present/missing data frame. grouping variable can provided optional total column (see totals()), well options.

title: Some Useful Functions
text: Creates summary table specified ‘ticked’ (binary) variables data frame. grouping variable can provided optional total column (see totals()), well options. NB: moment function summarises variables "Ticked", "", NA.

title: Some Useful Functions
text: Creates summary table numbers events number percentage individuals adverse event data (although used event data). grouping variable can provided optional total column (see totals()), well options. NB: moment need create variable beforehand (e.g., called “AEs”) summarise total count AEs.

title: Some Useful Functions
text: Typically write reports R Markdown (exporting pdf) like use ‘xtable’ package convert tables LaTeX. However, found occasionally ‘xtable’ doesn’t much versatility ’d like. functions assist .

title: Some Useful Functions
text: Produces list ‘pos’ ‘command’ use print.xtable()’s add..row option. create partial horizontal line across specified columns table. Users can either specify row numbers ’d like add \cline function look rows use multirow specified column.

text: Turns duplicate rows (within variable) occur consecutively NAs adds multirow remaining rows.

text: use print.xtable()’s add..row tabular.environment = "longtable". function Formats header information xtable adding printed output position 0 repeated table crosses next page.

text: Collapses vector character string separated “&”, helpful add..row option xtable().

title: Some Useful Functions
text: save time writing statistics reports created R Markdown template. Currently report exports pdf (personal preference) modified export word. can access template either creating new R Markdown document menu RStudio looking templates using rmarkdown::draft("-report.Rmd", template = "statistics-report", package = "Useful.functions"). options create folder report name containing markdown file templates required generate report. recommend render pdf using rmarkdown::render rather using knit button. *NB: plan create templates future - e.g., status reports presentations.

what: Adds LaTex \clines to an object of class
title: Adds LaTex \clines to an object of class
text: Produces list 'pos' 'command' use xtable()'s add..row option. create partial horizontal line across specified columns table. Users can either specify row numbers like add cline function look rows use multirow specified column.

title: Adds LaTex \clines to an object of class
Adds LaTex \clines to an object of class
text: xtab xtable object rows either "multirow" (default) row numbers add cline cols character string columns draw cline (e.g, "2-3") check.column character string column check rows = "multirow"

title: Adds LaTex \clines to an object of class
text: list levels 'pos' 'command' give add..row option xtable().

title: Adds LaTex \clines to an object of class
code: xtab <- xtable::xtable(head(iris))  xtable::print.xtable(xtab, add.to.row = add_clines(., rows = c(2, 3), cols = "3-4")) #> % latex table generated in R 4.4.1 by xtable 1.8-4 package #> % Mon Oct 28 13:43:15 2024 #> \begin{table}[ht] #> \centering #> \begin{tabular}{rrrrrl} #>   \hline #>  & Sepal.Length & Sepal.Width & Petal.Length & Petal.Width & Species \\  #>   \hline #> 1 & 5.10 & 3.50 & 1.40 & 0.20 & setosa \\  #>   2 & 4.90 & 3.00 & 1.40 & 0.20 & setosa \\  #>    \cline{3-4} #> 3 & 4.70 & 3.20 & 1.30 & 0.20 & setosa \\  #>    \cline{3-4} #> 4 & 4.60 & 3.10 & 1.50 & 0.20 & setosa \\  #>   5 & 5.00 & 3.60 & 1.40 & 0.20 & setosa \\  #>   6 & 5.40 & 3.90 & 1.70 & 0.40 & setosa \\  #>    \hline #> \end{tabular} #> \end{table}

what: For use with latex summary tables — add_multirow
title: For use with latex summary tables — add_multirow
text: Turns duplicate rows occur together NAs adds multirow remaining rows.

title: For use with latex summary tables — add_multirow
code: add_multirow(   x,   width = "*",   pos = "t",   rows = .,   reverse = FALSE,   hline = TRUE )

title: For use with latex summary tables — add_multirow
text: x Character vector width Desired width column passed multirow latex. e.g. "4cm" pos Character defining vertical positioning text multirow block. Default "t" - top. options "c" centre "b" bottom. rows Optional number rows use, given add_multirow calculates many rows use. reverse TRUE last duplicate removed. rows given calculated number rows negated. features useful colouring tables. hline Logical indicating whether hline added start multirow.

title: For use with latex summary tables — add_multirow
text: character string/vector

title: For use with latex summary tables — add_multirow
code:
x <- c(rep("a", 5), rep("c", 2), rep("y", 7))     add_multirow(x) #>  [1] "\hline
\multirow[t]{5}{*}{a}" NA                                #>  [3] NA                                NA                                #>  [5] NA                                "\hline
\multirow[t]{2}{*}{c}" #>  [7] NA                                "\hline
\multirow[t]{7}{*}{y}" #>  [9] NA                                NA                                #> [11] NA                                NA                                #> [13] NA                                NA                                    add_multirow(x, reverse = TRUE) #>  [1] NA                                 NA                                 #>  [3] NA                                 NA                                 #>  [5] "\hline
\multirow[t]{-5}{*}{a}" NA                                 #>  [7] "\hline
\multirow[t]{-2}{*}{c}" NA                                 #>  [9] NA                                 NA                                 #> [11] NA                                 NA                                 #> [13] NA                                 "\hline
\multirow[t]{-7}{*}{y}"     add_multirow(x, width = "2cm", pos = "c") #>  [1] "\hline
\multirow[c]{5}{2cm}{a}" NA                                  #>  [3] NA                                  NA                                  #>  [5] NA                                  "\hline
\multirow[c]{2}{2cm}{c}" #>  [7] NA                                  "\hline
\multirow[c]{7}{2cm}{y}" #>  [9] NA                                  NA                                  #> [11] NA                                  NA                                  #> [13] NA                                  NA

what: Produce a data frame to summaries continuous variables — continuous_table
title: Produce a data frame to summaries continuous variables — continuous_table
text: Takes data frame produces grouped un-grouped summaries mean standard deviation continuous variables.

title: Produce a data frame to summaries continuous variables — continuous_table
code: continuous_table(   df = .,   ...,   group = .,   time = .,   total = TRUE,   digits = 2,   condense = FALSE )

title: Produce a data frame to summaries continuous variables — continuous_table
text: df Data frame ... Variables summarised group Optional variable defines grouping time Optional variable repeated measures (currently must used group) total Logical indicating whether total column created digits Number digits right decimal point condense variable scoring columns output condensed one column?

title: Produce a data frame to summaries continuous variables — continuous_table
text: tibble data frame summarising data

title: Produce a data frame to summaries continuous variables — continuous_table
code: continuous_table(df = iris, Petal.Length, Petal.Width, group = Species) #> # A tibble: 9 × 6 #>   variable     scoring      Total             setosa        versicolor virginica #>   <chr>        <chr>        <chr>             <chr>         <chr>      <chr>     #> 1 NA           NA           N = 150           N = 50        N = 50     N = 50    #> 2 Petal.Length n            150               50            50         50        #> 3 Petal.Length Mean (SD)    3.76 (1.77)       1.46 (0.17)   4.26 (0.4… 5.55 (0.… #> 4 Petal.Length Median (IQR) 4.35 (1.60, 5.10) 1.50 (1.40, … 4.35 (4.0… 5.55 (5.… #> 5 Petal.Length Min, Max     1, 6.9            1, 1.9        3, 5.1     4.5, 6.9  #> 6 Petal.Width  n            150               50            50         50        #> 7 Petal.Width  Mean (SD)    1.20 (0.76)       0.25 (0.11)   1.33 (0.2… 2.03 (0.… #> 8 Petal.Width  Median (IQR) 1.30 (0.30, 1.80) 0.20 (0.20, … 1.30 (1.2… 2.00 (1.… #> 9 Petal.Width  Min, Max     0.1, 2.5          0.1, 0.6      1, 1.8     1.4, 2.5      continuous_table(df = iris, Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, group = Species,                      total = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 9 × 5 #>   variable     scoring      setosa            versicolor        virginica        #>   <chr>        <chr>        <chr>             <chr>             <chr>            #> 1 NA           NA           N = 50            N = 50            N = 50           #> 2 Sepal.Length n            50                50                50               #> 3 Sepal.Length Mean (SD)    5.01 (0.35)       5.94 (0.52)       6.59 (0.64)      #> 4 Sepal.Length Median (IQR) 5.00 (4.80, 5.20) 5.90 (5.60, 6.30) 6.50 (6.23, 6.9… #> 5 Sepal.Length Min, Max     4.3, 5.8          4.9, 7            4.9, 7.9         #> 6 Sepal.Width  n            50                50                50               #> 7 Sepal.Width  Mean (SD)    3.43 (0.38)       2.77 (0.31)       2.97 (0.32)      #> 8 Sepal.Width  Median (IQR) 3.40 (3.20, 3.68) 2.80 (2.52, 3.00) 3.00 (2.80, 3.1… #> 9 Sepal.Width  Min, Max     2.3, 4.4          2, 3.4            2.2, 3.8             continuous_table(df = iris, Petal.Length, Sepal.Length, digits = 1) #> # A tibble: 9 × 3 #>   variable     scoring      value          #>   <chr>        <chr>        <chr>          #> 1 NA           NA           N = 150        #> 2 Petal.Length n            150            #> 3 Petal.Length Mean (SD)    3.8 (1.8)      #> 4 Petal.Length Median (IQR) 4.3 (1.6, 5.1) #> 5 Petal.Length Min, Max     1, 6.9         #> 6 Sepal.Length n            150            #> 7 Sepal.Length Mean (SD)    5.8 (0.8)      #> 8 Sepal.Length Median (IQR) 5.8 (5.1, 6.4) #> 9 Sepal.Length Min, Max     4.3, 7.9

title: Produce a dataframe to summarise discrete variables — discrete_table
text: df Data Frame ... Variables summarised group Optional variable defines grouping time Optional variable repeated measures (currenlty must used group) total Logical indicating whether total column created n Logical indicating whether percentages n (n = TRUE) N (n = FALSE) missing String determining missing data called (n = TRUE). Default "Missing". accuracy see details scales::percent condense variable scoring columns output condensed one column?

title: Produce a dataframe to summarise discrete variables — discrete_table
text: tibble data frame summarising data

title: Produce a dataframe to summarise discrete variables — discrete_table
code: library(ggplot2) # for the data     discrete_table(df = mpg, drv, group = manufacturer) #> # A tibble: 4 × 18 #>   variable scoring Total       audi    chevrolet dodge ford  honda hyundai jeep  #>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>       <chr>   <chr>     <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>   <chr> #> 1 NA       NA      N = 234     N = 18  N = 19    N = … N = … N = 9 N = 14  N = 8 #> 2 drv      4       103 (44.0%) 11 (61… 4 (21.1%) 26 (… 13 (… 0 (0… 0 (0.0… 8 (1… #> 3 drv      f       106 (45.3%) 7 (38.… 5 (26.3%) 11 (… 0 (0… 9 (1… 14 (10… 0 (0… #> 4 drv      r       25 (10.7%)  0 (0.0… 10 (52.6… 0 (0… 12 (… 0 (0… 0 (0.0… 0 (0… #> # ℹ 8 more variables: `land rover` <chr>, lincoln <chr>, mercury <chr>, #> #   nissan <chr>, pontiac <chr>, subaru <chr>, toyota <chr>, volkswagen <chr>     discrete_table(df = mpg, drv) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   variable scoring value       #>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>       #> 1 NA       NA      N = 234     #> 2 drv      4       103 (44.0%) #> 3 drv      f       106 (45.3%) #> 4 drv      r       25 (10.7%)

title: Searches a list of dataframes. — search_list
text: ls list dataframes string string, either exact variable name something search . exact Logical. exact = TRUE search_list finds exact variable, exact = FALSE search_list finds variable names containing string using stringr::str_detect(). ignore.case Logical. Determines whether ignore case exact = FALSE.

title: Searches a list of dataframes. — search_list
text: data.frame

title: Searches a list of dataframes. — search_list
code: files <- list(mtcars = mtcars, iris = iris) search_list(files, "Sepal", exact = FALSE) #>   file     variable #> 1 iris Sepal.Length #> 2 iris  Sepal.Width search_list(files, "hp") #>     file variable #> 1 mtcars       hp

title: String wrapping for factor variables — strwrap_factor
code:
nt_yorks <- factor(c("Beningbrough Hall (Historic House)",                      "Braithwaite Hall (Historic Property)",                      "Brimham Rocks (Countryside)",                      "East Riddlesden Hall (Historic House)",                      "Fountains Abbey (Abbey)",                      "Gibson's Mill (Historic Property)",                      "Goddards House & Garden (Historic House)",                      "Hardcastle Crags (Countryside)",                      "Hudswell Woods (Countryside)",                      "Maister House (Historic Property)",                      "Moulton Hall (Historic Property)",                      "Nostell Priory (Historic House)",                      "Nunnington Hall (Historic Property)",                      "Rievaulx Terrace and Temples (Garden)",                      "Roseberry Topping (Countryside)",                      "Studley Royal Water Garden (Garden)",                      "The Bridestones (Countryside)",                      "Treasurers House (Historic Property)"))  strwrap_factor(nt_yorks, width = 10) #>  [1] Beningbrough

what: Produce a dataframe to summarise ticked variables — ticked_table
title: Produce a dataframe to summarise ticked variables — ticked_table
text: Takes dataframe produces number percentage ticked variables.

title: Produce a dataframe to summarise ticked variables — ticked_table
code: ticked_table(df = ., ..., group = ., sep = ., condense = FALSE, total = TRUE)

title: Produce a dataframe to summarise ticked variables — ticked_table
text: df Data Frame ... Variables summarised group Optional variable defines grouping sep Optional separator columns splitting variable variable scoring. See ?tidyr::separate information. condense variable scoring columns output condensed one column? used sep specified. total Logical indicating whether total column created

title: Produce a dataframe to summarise ticked variables — ticked_table
text: tibble data frame summarising data

title: Produce a dataframe to summarise ticked variables — ticked_table
code: df <- data.frame(          pet_cat = sample(c("Ticked", ""), size = 100, replace = TRUE),          pet_dog = sample(c("Ticked", ""), size = 100, replace = TRUE),          pet_pig = sample(c("Ticked", ""), size = 100, replace = TRUE),          group = sample(c("A", "B", "C"), size = 100, replace = TRUE)  )    ticked_table(df, pet_cat, pet_dog, group = group, sep = "_") #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   variable scoring A          B          C          Total      #>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>      <chr>      <chr>      <chr>      #> 1 NA       NA      N = 30     N = 37     N = 33     N = 100    #> 2 pet      cat     14 (46.7%) 18 (48.6%) 19 (57.6%) 51 (51.0%) #> 3 pet      dog     15 (50.0%) 20 (54.1%) 19 (57.6%) 54 (54.0%)    ticked_table(df, pet_pig, pet_dog) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   scoring value      #>   <chr>   <chr>      #> 1 NA      N = 100    #> 2 pet_pig 52 (52.0%) #> 3 pet_dog 54 (54.0%)
